item.title: By: Sharad Goel
item.dc:creator: Sharad Goel
item.description: Dave, you caught us! We were forced to post in march to maintain our one-post-per-month minimum. I guess that's the downside of commitment devices; the upside is that we actually write a post once in a while.
item.content:encoded: Dave, you caught us! We were forced to post in march to maintain our one-post-per-month minimum. I guess that’s the downside of commitment devices; the upside is that we actually write a post once in a while.

item.content:encoded: Since this posted on March 31 I have no choice but to take everything here at face value

item.title: By: Sharad Goel
item.dc:creator: Sharad Goel
item.description: <a href="http://everythingisobvious.com/" rel="nofollow">Duncan Watts</a> asked, "Isn't there some way to combine power laws and puppies? That would be even awesomer." Well, I couldn't agree more! So here's some <a href="/wp-content/uploads/2011/03/puppy_powerlaw.jpg" rel="nofollow">puppy power law data porn</a>. And, yes, those <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_most_popular_dog_breeds" rel="nofollow">registration statistics</a> are real---puppy registrations do indeed follow a power law!
item.content:encoded: Duncan Watts asked, “Isn’t there some way to combine power laws and puppies? That would be even awesomer.” Well, I couldn’t agree more! So here’s some puppy power law data porn. And, yes, those registration statistics are real—puppy registrations do indeed follow a power law!

item.title: By: Lev Reyzin
item.dc:creator: Lev Reyzin
item.description:
Sharad has informed me my self-imposed blackout period can end, so I'll post my solution to the puzzle:
Take any 10 dice and say they sum to n. Flip them; now they sum to 70 - n (b/c sum of opposite sides is 7 and there are 10 dice). These make the first pile. The remaining 20 dice make the second pile, which also sums to 70-n (b/c the total was originally 70).
item.content:encoded:
Sharad has informed me my self-imposed blackout period can end, so I’ll post my solution to the puzzle:

Take any 10 dice and say they sum to n. Flip them; now they sum to 70 – n (b/c sum of opposite sides is 7 and there are 10 dice). These make the first pile. The remaining 20 dice make the second pile, which also sums to 70-n (b/c the total was originally 70).

item.title: By: Sharad Goel
item.dc:creator: Sharad Goel
item.description: Aaron, I love how you have power law poetry ready to go on a moment's notice!
item.content:encoded: Aaron, I love how you have power law poetry ready to go on a moment’s notice!

item.title: By: Aaron
item.dc:creator: Aaron
item.content:encoded:
I once also tried to make power-law poetry. The result was gruel, but here it is:

Three Power Laws for the Physicists, mathematics in thrall,
Four for the biologists, species and all,
Eighteen behavioral, our will carved in stone,
One for the Dark Lord on his dark throne.

In the Land of Science where Power Laws lie,
One Paper to rule them all, One Paper to find them,
One Paper to bring them all and in their moments bind them,
In the Land of Science, where Power Laws lie.

Something about my paper having the current most mentions of “power law” in it, of all the power-law articles on the arxiv, fills me with satisfaction.

item.description: This post is full of win. You had me at the haiku. <3 power laws.
item.content:encoded: This post is full of win. You had me at the haiku. <3 power laws.
